scenario:
Dividend stocks have outperformed non-payers by more than two to one over the last 50 years. Companies with high dividend growth track records, such as Brookfield Renewable and Chevron, offer higher-yielding payouts and have more growth ahead. 

Brookfield Renewable has grown its dividend at a 6% compound annual rate since 2001 and expects to continue this trend with a 5% to 9% annual rate over the long term. The company has highly visible growth ahead due to long-term power purchase agreements and a pipeline of renewable energy development projects. It aims to deliver more than 10% annual FFO per-share growth for at least the next five years, adding to its more than 5% yielding dividend.

Chevron has increased its dividend for over 30 straight years and delivered more than 5% annual dividend growth over the last five years. The company is investing in developing its highest-return assets, on track to grow its free cash flow at a more than 10% annual rate through 2027. Chevron has the financial flexibility to repurchase shares and grow its 4.5%-yielding dividend, with the potential to grow its free cash flow even faster if it closes its acquisition of Hess. 

Both companies have excellent records of increasing their dividends, higher yields, and more growth ahead, making them top-notch dividend growth stocks to buy.
